bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frederick L. Rath, Jr., May 26, 1952

div1.p: Hench is delighted that Rath visited the Finca San Jose and is sure his advice will be helpful to Rojas. He sends a check for Rath's expenses.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Frederick L. Rath, Jr., May 26, 1952
div1.opener:
File under National Trust
May 26, 1952
Mr. Frederick L. Rath, Jr., Director
National Trust for Historic Preservation
712 Jackson Place N.W.
Washington 6, D. C.
My dear Mr. Rath:
div1.p:
I have been intensely interested in your two
letters and am delighted indeed that you went
to Cuba. I am sure you have helped my friends
immensely and may also be able to help me with
advice regarding my own special interests there.

Permit me to send you the check made out as you
suggested and I am very grateful for your help.

I am about to take Professor and Mrs. Henry
Moore of Dublin around the Clinic. They are
my guests for a week and have just arrived,
hence the shortness of this note. I will
write you further in a few days.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
Enclosure
